title: Rice import deadline ends, 167,000 MT imported
byline: The deadline for importing rice ended at midnight yesterday, with a total of 167,000 MT of rice imported to Sri Lanka since the government allowed the imports.

title: Former football legend Ronaldo enjoys safari in Sri Lanka
byline: A photograph of former Brazilian football star Ronaldo Nazario enjoying a safari at a Sri Lankan national park has been circulating widely on social media.

title: Teenage girl dies after falling from 12th floor in Borella
byline: The Borella Police have launched an investigation after a 16-year-old girl was found dead after falling from the 12th floor of a 24-story apartment complex in Borella.

title: Traders up in arms against mill owners not providing rice at affordable rates in view of Thai Pongal
byline: The traders in several areas of the upcountry yesterday demonstrated demanding the supply of adequate stocks of Nadu and Red rice varieties in view of the Thai Pongal festive season.

title: Government announces excise duty on vehicle imports effective from today
byline: While issuing a special gazette notification, the government announced an excise duty percentage on all vehicles imported starting in February, following the resumption of vehicle imports after a five-year suspension.

title: Decades-old Elephant Pass saltern to be activated fully to address salt shortage
byline: In a bid to address the salt shortage, chairman of National Salt Limited Gayan Wellala said plans are underway to fully activate the saltern including one in Elephant Pass in the north by March, this year to increase production of salt in the country

title: Trump avoids prison or fine in hush-money case sentencing
byline: A judge has sentenced US President-elect Donald Trump to an ’’unconditional discharge,’’ bringing to an end the first criminal trial of a former US president.

title: Over 100mm rain expected today
byline: Heavy showers exceeding 100 mm are expected in the Eastern, Uva, and Central provinces, as well as in the Polonnaruwa district today, the Forecasting Division of the National Meteorological Centre said.

title: Road crashes kill over 12,000 lives in five years
byline: Senior Professor of Forensic Medicine at Karapitiya Hospital U.C.P Perera said it was a matter of serious concern that the fatalities in road accidents have been increasing at a large proportion every year and that 118,240 road accidents had occurred in Sri Lanka for the last five years up to December 2024 claiming 12,140 human lives.

title: Sri Lanka’s tea industry set for cautious growth in 2025: Forbes and Walker Tea Brokers
byline: Sri Lanka’s tea industry is set for a year of modest growth in 2025, despite facing several challenges and uncertainties, an analysis by Forbes and Walker Tea Brokers showed.

title: Devapathiraja players star in Sri Lanka’s U-19 Women’s World Cup squad
byline: Sri Lanka’s squad for the upcoming ICC Under-19 Women’s T20 World Cup has been announced, with the tournament set to take place in Malaysia from January 18 to February 2.

title: Bangladesh star Tamim Iqbal retires from international cricket
byline: Former Bangladesh captain Tamim Iqbal announced his retirement from international cricket on Friday with the 35-year-old star run-getter insisting the ’’chapter is over’’.

title: IndiGo becomes largest foreign carrier out of Sri Lanka
byline:
India’s IndiGo becomes the largest foreign carrier out of Sri Lanka, with it operating 54 weekly flights.
The airline operates to two cities in Sri Lanka – Colombo and Jaffna, from four cities in India – Bangalore, Chennai, Hyderabad and Mumbai.

title: Women’s leadership gap hinders SL’s economic growth: Prime Minister
byline: Sri Lanka must prioritise women’s participation in the business and decision-making roles as a strategic necessity for economic growth, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said, asserting the need for greater gender inclusivity in the corporate sector.

title: 6% increase in liquor prices
byline: The Finance Ministry announced a 6% increase in Excise Duty on liquor, effective from tomorrow, as per a Gazette notification.

title: Cigarette prices increased
byline: The Ceylon Tobacco Company (CTC) has announced that, following the increase in Excise Duty, cigarette prices will be raised under four categories starting from January 11, 2025.

title: Duminda Silva transferred from prison hospital to Welikada
byline: Following a recommendation by a specialist doctor, R. Duminda Silva has been transferred from the prison hospital to a general ward at the Welikada Prison, Prisons Commissioner and media spokesman Gamini B. Dissanayake said.

title: 2024 first year to pass 1.5C global warming limit
byline: The planet has moved a major step closer to warming more than 1.5C, new data shows, despite world leaders vowing a decade ago they would try to avoid this.

title: Sri Lankan brides seek justice after foreign husbands abandon them
byline: A concerning trend of young Sri Lankan women being abandoned by foreign husbands shortly after marriage has come to light following a recent submission made by a lawyer before a Colombo court.

title: Update: Udayanga Weeratunga remanded
byline: Former Sri Lankan Ambassador to Russia, Udayanga Weeratunga, who was arrested over assault of a neighbor, has been remanded until January 17 after being produced before the Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court.
